s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the thrust clearance.
Using a dial indicator, measure the thrust clearance.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the thrust clearance.
Using a dial indicator, measure the radial clearance.
Using a dial indicator, measure the radial clearance.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the 2nd gear needle roller bearing.

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the radial clearance.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the 3rd gear needle roller bearing.

s2.ptxt: Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the drive gear.
Using a magnet hand, remove the ball.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the other snap ring.
Using 2 screwdrivers and a hammer, tap out the snap ring from the output shaft.
Using SST and a press, press out the 5th gear, center bearing, 1st gear, 1st gear needle roller bearing and 1st gear bearing inner race from the output shaft.
Remove the No. 1 synchronizer ring (for the 1st gear) from the No. 1 clutch hub.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE 1ST GEAR BEARING INNER RACE LOCK BALL

s2.ptxt: Using a magnet hand, remove the lock ball.
Using SST and a press, press out the No. 1 clutch hub reverse gear, No. 1 synchronizer ring and 2nd gear.
Remove the No. 1 synchronizer ring from the 2nd gear.
Remove the needle roller bearing from the output shaft.
Remove the 2 synchromesh shifting key springs.
Remove the reverse gear and 3 synchromesh shifting keys from the transmission clutch hub.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring from the output shaft.
Using a press, press out the No. 2 clutch hub and 3rd gear.
Remove the synchronizer ring from the 3rd gear.
Remove the needle roller bearing from the output shaft.
Remove the 2 synchromesh shifting key springs.
Remove the transmission hub sleeve and 3 synchromesh shifting keys from the transmission clutch hub.
Using a micrometer, measure the outside diameter of the output shaft journal surface.

item.ptxt: If the outside diameter is not as specified, replace the output shaft.

s2.ptxt: Using a micrometer, measure the flange thickness.

item.ptxt: If the thickness is less than the minimum, replace the output shaft.

s2.ptxt: Using a micrometer, measure the inner race thickness.

item.ptxt: If the thickness is less than the minimum, replace the 1st gear bearing inner race.

s2.ptxt: Using a micrometer, measure the outside diameter of the inner race.

item.ptxt: If the outside diameter is less than the minimum, replace the 1st gear bearing inner race.

s2.ptxt: Coat the 1st gear cone with gear oil. Check the braking effect of the No. 1 synchronizer ring. Fit the ring to the shaft cone. Apply pressure to the ring and attempt to turn it in both directions. Check that the ring locks.

item.ptxt: If the braking effect is insufficient, apply a small amount of fine lapping compound between the No. 1 synchronizer ring and the 1st gear cone. Lightly rub the No. 1 synchronizer ring and the 1st gear cone together.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Check the braking effect of the No. 1 synchronizer ring again.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the clearance between the No. 1 synchronizer ring back and 1st gear spline end.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the No. 1 synchronizer ring and apply a small amount of fine lapping compound on the 1st gear cone.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Coat the 2nd gear cone with gear oil. Check the braking effect of the No. 1 synchronizer ring. Fit the ring to the shaft cone. Apply pressure to the ring and attempt to turn it in both directions. Check that the ring locks.

item.ptxt: If the braking effect is insufficient, apply a small amount of fine lapping compound between the No. 1 synchronizer ring and the 2nd gear cone. Lightly rub the No. 1 synchronizer ring and the 2nd gear cone together.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Check the braking effect of the No. 1 synchronizer ring again.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the clearance between the No. 1 synchronizer ring back and 2nd gear spline end.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the No. 1 synchronizer ring, and apply a small amount of fine lapping compound on the 2nd gear cone.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Coat the 3rd gear cone with gear oil. Check the braking effect of the No. 2 synchronizer ring. Fit the ring to the shaft cone. Apply pressure to the ring and attempt to turn it in both directions. Check that the ring locks.

item.ptxt: If the braking effect is insufficient, apply a small amount of fine lapping compound between the No. 2 synchronizer ring and the 3rd gear cone. Lightly rub the No. 2 synchronizer ring and the 3rd gear cone together.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Check the braking effect of the No. 2 synchronizer ring again.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the clearance between the No. 2 synchronizer ring back and 3rd gear spline end.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the No. 2 synchronizer ring and apply a small amount of fine lapping compound on the 3rd gear cone.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Using a vernier caliper, measure the clearance between the reverse gear and No. 1 gear shift fork.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is less than the minimum, replace the No. 1 gear shift fork and reverse gear.

s2.ptxt: Check that the No. 1 transmission clutch hub and reverse gear slide smoothly.
Check that the spline gear's edges of the reverse gear are not worn down.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the No. 2 hub sleeve and No. 2 gear shift fork as shown in the illustration.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the transmission hub sleeve and the No. 2 gear shift fork.

s2.ptxt: Check the sliding condition between the No. 2 hub sleeve and No. 2 clutch hub.
Check that the spline gear's edges of the No. 2 transmission hub sleeve are not worn down.
Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the 1st gear.

item.ptxt: If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the 1st gear.

s2.ptxt: Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the 2nd gear.

item.ptxt: If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the 2nd gear.

s2.ptxt: Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the 3rd gear.

item.ptxt: If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the 3rd gear.
